description.plain:
Gabriella Michelle Henderson, known as Ella Henderson, is a singer and songwriter from Tetney.
She was born on January 12th 1996 and was a contestant on the ninth series of The X Factor.
Her debut studio album, Chapter One, was released on the 10th of October 2014.

body.plain:
Gabriella Michelle Henderson, known as Ella Henderson, is a singer and songwriter from Tetney.
She was born on January 12th 1996 and was a contestant on the ninth series of The X Factor.
Her debut studio album, Chapter One, was released on the 10th of October 2014.

songs.title: Ghost

description.plain:
Ella launched her #ghosttrail campaign which lead up to the first single release to her first album, Chapter One.



In an interview with 95.8 Capital FM, she talks about collaborating with Ryan Tedder (of OneRepublic). She claims to have turned 18 while recording in the booth. She goes a little behind what it means, even being unsure about seeing a ghost:

I think this song is more like the euphemism of word ghost is like, is like someone or something tormenting you. You’re just trying to get rid of this torment of somebody who’s got complete control over you. Ya know you can’t eat, you can’t sleep, it’s got complete control over you.

With Idolator, Ella goes in deeper about what exactly happened before the single dropped, hitting #1 on iTunes in two minutes.

songs.embed_content: Read “Ghost” by Ella Henderson on Genius

body.plain:
Ella launched her #ghosttrail campaign which lead up to the first single release to her first album, Chapter One.



In an interview with 95.8 Capital FM, she talks about collaborating with Ryan Tedder (of OneRepublic). She claims to have turned 18 while recording in the booth. She goes a little behind what it means, even being unsure about seeing a ghost:

I think this song is more like the euphemism of word ghost is like, is like someone or something tormenting you. You’re just trying to get rid of this torment of somebody who’s got complete control over you. Ya know you can’t eat, you can’t sleep, it’s got complete control over you.

With Idolator, Ella goes in deeper about what exactly happened before the single dropped, hitting #1 on iTunes in two minutes.

'Cause I need something that can wash out the pain
And at most, I'm sleeping all these demons away
But your ghost, the ghost of you
It keeps me awake

Yeah they saw what's inside of you
You tried hiding another you
But your evil was coming through
These eyes sitting on the wall

Bright light living in the shade
Your cold heart makes my spirit shake

Yeah it's still burning

'Cause I love living innocent

True love was gonna hurt
True pain I don't deserve
Truth is that I never learned

I keep going to the river...

[Chorus]
I keep going to the river to pray

But your ghost, the ghost of you

songs.title: Yours

description.plain:
“Yours” is a song by English Songwriter and Singer Ella Henderson. Released on November 30 of 2014 in the United Kingdom, “Yours” was released via Syco Music as Henderson’s third single off of her debut studio album, Chapter One. This song is co-written and produced by Josh Records to express how Henderson is ready to take the love that’s being offered to her, and that she is ready to accept being the girl of a man.

The single has successfully sold in excess of 200,000 copies since its release in 2014, and has achieved a BPI accreditation. The highest peaking of the song in the charts was in Scotland, where it peaked at 8th. The song also peaked at number 16 on the UK Singles chart. “Yours” was certified silver in the UK.

The corresponding black and white music video was released on December 5 of 2014, directed by James Lees.

songs.embed_content: Read “Yours” by Ella Henderson on Genius

body.plain:
“Yours” is a song by English Songwriter and Singer Ella Henderson. Released on November 30 of 2014 in the United Kingdom, “Yours” was released via Syco Music as Henderson’s third single off of her debut studio album, Chapter One. This song is co-written and produced by Josh Records to express how Henderson is ready to take the love that’s being offered to her, and that she is ready to accept being the girl of a man.

The single has successfully sold in excess of 200,000 copies since its release in 2014, and has achieved a BPI accreditation. The highest peaking of the song in the charts was in Scotland, where it peaked at 8th. The song also peaked at number 16 on the UK Singles chart. “Yours” was certified silver in the UK.

songs.lyrics:
17 ContributorsYours Lyrics[Verse 1]
I wear your winter coat
The one you love to wear
So I keep feeling close
To what's beyond compare
The moments waking up
You catch me in your eyes
That beauty on my pillow
That holds me in the night

[Pre-Chorus]
And I will find my strength to un-tape my mouth
When I used to be afraid of the words
But with you I've learned just to let it out
Now my heart is ready to burst
[Chorus]
'Cause I, I feel like I'm ready for love
And I wanna be your everything and more
And I know every day you say it
But I just want you to be sure
That I'm yours

[Verse 2]
And if I've been feeling heavy
You take me from the dark
Your arms they keep me steady
So nothing could fall apart

[Pre-Chorus]
And I will find my strength to un-tape my mouth
When I used to be afraid of the words
But with you I've learned just to let it out
Now my heart is ready to burst

[Chorus]
'Cause I, I feel like I'm ready for love
And I wanna be your everything and more
And I know every day you say it
But I just want you to be sure
That I'm yours
That I'm yoursYou might also like18Embed

songs.title: Friends
songs.embed_content: Read “Friends” by Ella Henderson on Genius
songs.lyrics:
4 ContributorsFriends Lyrics[Verse 1]
You watched me go through my first break up
We ate enough ice cream to never want more
When I need a pick me up, you pick me up
When I wanna cry when my heart is stuck
You're the first one at my door

[Pre-Chorus]
And the boyfriends may change
And so will our second names
But one thing stays the same is us
We'll make dumb mistakes, but we ain't to blame
'Cause they bring out the best in us
[Chorus]
Friends, with you to the end
Fix you, help you bend, when it gets tough
And when you're scared, they're gon' be right there
So hold onto your friends, friends

[Verse 2]
I was right there when you struggled with Ryan
And you were right here when my dad went away
All of the weekends we stayed out
All of the hangovers, laid on the couch
Yeah, the times we don't talk about

[Pre-Chorus]
And the boyfriends may change
And so will our second names
But one thing stays the same is us, yeah
We'll make dumb mistakes, we ain't to blame
'Cause they bring out the best in us

[Chorus]
Friends, with you to the end
Fix you, help you bend, when it gets tough
And when you're scared, they're gon' be right there
So hold onto your friends, friends
You might also like[Bridge]
There'll be good times and bad times
There'll be troubles ahead
There'll be tears in mascara
And we'll all look a mess
What's a life without a drama?
Oh, so don't you forgot
We ain't close to broken yet
We ain't close to broken yet

[Outro]
Ooh
Ooh, oh
Oh
We ain't close to broken yet
Ooh
Ooh, oh
OhEmbed
